metadata.Title: CVE-2023-3326 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - low.
metadata.Description: pam_krb5 authenticates a user by essentially running kinit with the password, getting a ticket-granting ticket (tgt) from the Kerberos KDC (Key Distribution Center) over the network, as a way to verify the password. However, if a keytab is not provisioned on the system, pam_krb5 has no way to validate the response from the KDC, and essentially trusts the tgt provided over the network as being valid. In a non-default FreeBSD installation that leverages pam_krb5 for authentication and does not have a keytab provisioned, an attacker that is able to control both the password and the KDC responses can return a valid tgt, allowing authentication to occur for any user on the system.

notes.Note: mdeslaur> per the comments on the oss-sec post, "pam_krb5 and sssd-krb5 are both affected by the same attack, but they have always been _documented_ to be affected". See the "verify_ap_req_nofail" option in the man page.  Deferring this CVE to see if a fix will be available, or if this isn't something that will ever get a fix because it works as documented.

criterions.comment: libpam-krb5 package in focal is affected, but a decision has been made to defer addressing it (note: '2023-06-23').
sssd package in focal is affected, but a decision has been made to defer addressing it (note: '2023-06-23').
